page.title: 18TRADITIONS IN BROUGHTY FERRY
page.content: On{Easter Sunday}the Broughty Ferry children go egg rolling,signifying the rolling of the stone from Jesus'tomb. They receive chocolate eggs,and they also boil normal eggs and paint them many colours.These eggs are rolled in many different places. On October 31st{Hallowe'en }the children go "guising."For this they dress themselves up in many weird and wonderful disguises.They then approach a house and ask the occupants if they wish to have guisers.If the occupants agree,they recite poems,sing songs or tell jokes for which they are rewarded.Another{Hallowe'en}custom is ducking for apples.Here basins full of water are filled with apples.Whoever is ducking kneels before the basin and tries to reach an apple with their mouth. .
